entries.meaning: (Northern England) A piece of mountain pasture to which a farm animal has become hefted; a heft.

verbs.description: heaf (third-person singular simple present heafs, present participle heafing, simple past and past participle heafed)

entries.meaning: (Northern England) (of farm animals, especially a flock of sheep) To become accustomed to and attached to an area of mountain pasture, seldom straying from it.
